reviewText: I loved this series along with Xena. Highlander, and Raven. I purchased the VHS tapes and then the DVD's. I just had surgery and figured that I would watch these series's to visit many of my favorite actors and episodes. I had not watched them for a long time. What is it with these DVD producers? They were released around 2003 and yet they have no CC's or subtitles. This is no way to treat loyal fans. The music has been made louder but the dialogue is now too soft to hear over the music. There are many people with decreased hearing not only due to aging and not all of the people who enjoyed these shows were in their early 20's to 30's, teenagers, or younger! It seems to me that the DVD's should at least be replaced with ones that have CC's and/or subtitles. 5 stars for the shows with no stars for the DVD companies who released these shows.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love & miss this show! It brings back memories. Me & my dad used to watch it together every week. I just started collecting all the seasons on dvd. I wish there were more shows like this one. If you love the story of Hercules then I definitely recommend this series!

reviewText: The older Anchor Bay version:the complete series box set.The disc are very poorly made and I had a difficult time playing many of the episodes on my Panasonic Blu ray dvd player! Around 10 episodes didn't play at all before I got a complete refund from Amazon! I played around 1/2 of the of the series only! The television show was great but, this box set is rotten! Maybe the new Universal version also, sold on Amazon will be better!
summary: Hercules : The Legendary Journeys Complete Series (Seasons 1-6 bundle)

reviewText: This is one of the best investments for the money... the location in New Zealand has the most beautiful scenery of anywhere, so having all the action set against that background made the series even more enjoyable.  Kevin Sorbo is a pleasure to look at, you learn a lesson in each episode, and also you don't have to fight every time to get people to listen. That's what he tries to accomplish. His buddy and best friend, played by Michael Hurst, is a great compliment to the fun and adventure of the show. His energy and Hercule's steadfastness go hand-in hand rounding out each episode making each one an enjoyable feast. Even though you can pretty much figure out that you have bullies to put down, the stories are good, the action is tops, and the bullies can sure take a fall !! Best thing I ever did was purchase this series.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I purchased the complete set to replace what I had on VHS. I haven't seen the show in almost ten years! I'm only on season two and it's not as good as I remembered. I think it got better when Kevin Smith, Ares, shows up in later episodes. Anyway, Hercules still saves the day but Xena did it better. I think it was because her storyline was more complicated and she was ruthless in the beginning. Overall, I give it a B+.
summary: Hercules good but not as good as Xena

reviewText: I love the dvd set and the television show. It showed a more modern approach to Hercules. I love the fact that he took love seriously and that he could commit to one woman when he was married or in a relationship. To me, this show taught some degree of morality. This is what todays society needs. A hero to look up to and to respect.

reviewText: If you liked the series, you will love the collection. If you have never seen the series, but are a fan of shows that are comedic, have action and adventure, and are a bit campy, then you'd like the series.  Kevin Sorbo and Michael Hurst are great in most of the episodes.  The guest starring characters are, for the most part, wonderful character actors.  I preferred the later seasons, because the effects and the material became better, but  all of the seasons were good in their own way.  I loved the commentaries on all of the episodes.  But then, I love behind the scenes stuff. Kevin and Michael both did commentaries throughout the series - mostly Kevin, but the later episodes had some with both of them in the commentaries.  Also plenty of interviews of the stars and some of the writers/directors/producers.  The set itself came on time and in great shape - no issues with any of the discs.
summary: Great for any fan of the show or those who like campy comedy, old time effects, and good drama

reviewText: What can I say about Hercules:The Legendary Journeys that hasn't already been said? This was more than a show,it was an experience never to be forgotten. The dvds are remarkable and the extras gave us insight into the show and those involved behind the scenes. My favorite extra is the footage of the series wrap party-it was obvious that everyone involved with the show was proud to have been a part of something so special and you'll get a kick out of hearing Kevin,Michael and Eric's version of My Way-priceless! There are interviews with Kevin,Michael,Sam Sorbo,Joel Trebeck and others which you will enjoy immensely! Five stars is not enough of a rating for this collection-believe me,it's that good!
summary: A story of ancient times and an unforgettable hero!

reviewText: Where the ancient gods were petty and cruel...But, wherever there was evil, wherever an innocent would suffer...there would be Hercules!Dear Lord! I watched the show when it was first-ran. After that, I caught it in syndication.  Finally, after all the waiting and wondering if I'd see it again (when Action Pack suspended it's airing on cable) it became available on DVD.Anthony Quinn is beautiful and believeable as Zeus, the all-powerful king of the gods. God rest his soul. Every time I see an episode with him in it, I miss him.Kevin Sorbo is an "every man" who portrays the hero everyone is looking for. In this crazy, mixed up world we live in who doesn't need a little hope that all men can be as kind as a Greek demigod?Michael Hurst is one of my favorite actors in this series. I loved his character (Hercules best friend) so much I named an adopted stray cat after him.A fun series if you love Greek mythology! Great writing, great acting and a sense of humor that is desperately needed once again on t.v.. Good, clean fun.
summary: This is a story of a time long ago...a time of myths and legends...
Title: N/A
